channel.title: Server turned offline after 3 weeks
channel.description:
Hee,
I have a server, wich i had online here on moparscape, and this morning.. I was looking through the serverstatus because my brother suddenly could not join my server anymore. I dont know what the problem is, and maybe one of you guys have a solution.
I have not changed anything.. Port = open, Server = running.. everything is still the same as when is was online.
Need help badly please.
WhiteSanta
Also, tried on my brothers computer. Same problem.. It has Always worked.. untill this morning, and i did not changed anything :/
**SOLUTION** [color=blue]Well, The router is resetted and restarted and the port is succesfully open now[/color]
[color=red]*When the connection is refused at canyouseeme.org , Just reset and restart the router, and open your ports again, then it wi'll works like it used to be.[/color]

item.title: Server turned offline after 3 weeks
item.dc:creator: @MrSnow1 MrSnow1
item.description:
@MrSnow1 wrote:

iam just running it on hamachi right now.

I will try again next week.

Thanks for helping

Well, The router is resetted and restarted and the port is succesfully open now

*When the connection is refused at canyouseeme.org , Just reset and restart the router, and open your ports again, then it wi’ll works like it used to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Server turned offline after 3 weeks
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Let me know that you know that the last server ip is different from the rest? not saying thats the problem but maybe theres no connection to that ip address to the world wide web? please respond…i could be totally wrong lol

Read full topic

item.title: Server turned offline after 3 weeks
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Skrillex_Craft, post:34, topic:527573”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646327.msg4346866#msg4346866 date=1376006232]

[quote author=Skrillex_Craft link=topic=646327.msg4346863#msg4346863 date=1376006124]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646327.msg4346860#msg4346860 date=1376005885]

Your point, you still don’t have to have no-ip, I hosted a server for like 3 years via my computer, then vps, then dedi… NO-IP was never used in any of these three cases… That’s my point…
[/quote]i used to be a host of a server 5 yrs ago that means i was 13 years

Both of you stop arguing on this thread.

OP: Try making sure your server is not running and then go to canyouseeme.org, test 43594, and check what the message says, it should say that the connection timed out. If it says anything else, there’s something blocking it.
Possible solutions:
Restart your computer.
Undo, and redo your port forwarding.
Make sure all your IPs are the same. That means your local IP (192.168.x.x) and your broadcast ID (Mine starts with 9x.xx).
Double check all firewalls, port blocks etc.
Check to see if any other program may be taking over the ports.

Again, these are possible solutions. None are guaranteed to work.

Also, in the past I’ve had issues with port forwarding, and then I used this program and it port forwarded for me properly (I did everything it did, but it apparently did it correctly xD).
[/quote]did u try PFPort??

Yeah, and I didn’t like the program, the maker of simple port forward is awesome, and he makes lots of free tools for windows.
[/quote]i use pfp for ma mc server and it works perfectly :p[/quote]
I don’t care what you use. Stop taking over topics.

The Web Guy:

As stated earlier, I don’t know if you have tried this, but are you sure it’s connecting to your local IP address? In the picture you posted of the port-forwarding interface on your router, it said that the local IPs were 192.168.1.(NOTHING) I’m not sure how your router is set up but every router I’ve worked with, when port-forwarding, there is usually a number in that place, I’m not sure what it means in your scenario that there isn’t. It should read ‘192.168.1.14’ for example, which is the local IP for your computer. To get your local IP go to Start > Run… > cmd, in the black box type, ‘ipconfig’.

The reason it’s missing the fourth, is because he used paint and covered/deleted it.
Because we can totally hack your LAN ip.

Read full topic

Both of you stop arguing on this thread.

OP: Try making sure your server is not running and then go to canyouseeme.org, test 43594, and check what the message says, it should say that the connection timed out. If it says anything else, there’s something blocking it.
Possible solutions:
Restart your computer.
Undo, and redo your port forwarding.
Make sure all your IPs are the same. That means your local IP (192.168.x.x) and your broadcast ID (Mine starts with 9x.xx).
Double check all firewalls, port blocks etc.
Check to see if any other program may be taking over the ports.

Again, these are possible solutions. None are guaranteed to work.

Also, in the past I’ve had issues with port forwarding, and then I used this program and it port forwarded for me properly (I did everything it did, but it apparently did it correctly xD).
[/quote]did u try PFPort??

Yeah, and I didn’t like the program, the maker of simple port forward is awesome, and he makes lots of free tools for windows.[/quote]i use pfp for ma mc server and it works perfectly

As stated earlier, I don’t know if you have tried this, but are you sure it’s connecting to your local IP address? In the picture you posted of the port-forwarding interface on your router, it said that the local IPs were 192.168.1.(NOTHING) I’m not sure how your router is set up but every router I’ve worked with, when port-forwarding, there is usually a number in that place, I’m not sure what it means in your scenario that there isn’t. It should read ‘192.168.1.14’ for example, which is the local IP for your computer. To get your local IP go to Start > Run… > cmd, in the black box type, ‘ipconfig’.
